document.title: Wisconsin Common Career and Technical Core Standards

C0CB7CF182414C128ED106492BFFF3C3.description: Describe involvement in a civic activity.

ADDE67BE5CB848F985522385A77455F2.description: Identify the roles and responsibilities of citizenship.

A47444E02D0C4868BB78F1A119CB99F8.description: Identify the role of community service and service learning in family, community and business and industry.

6CD507750FF94BF4A85E0C8204AA839F.description: Demonstrate commitment and a positive attitude toward team goals.

AEA2BE696CE2477EA7FD42D3E4E3F06C.description: Work with a group to meet objectives while including all members.

E40C2073786A4D5BB9BCAD3B9E522225.description: Employ teamwork skills to achieve collective goals and use team members/talents effectively.

0E8101C8C35E48B8885F304EE1AE03F6.description: Describe leadership in relation to trust, positive attitude, integrity, willingness and commitment to accept key responsibilities in a group project.

8D5C9552C14C4BBA8DCF5564CBD51125.description: Describe effective leadership and teamwork skills and identify ways to participate in civic activities in school, family or the community.

320C555BB14B4431B15196C97264BD4A.description: Create a community of trust, giving space for different opinions and ideas to help students develop plans and prioritize tasks.

7165375EE2AE49378A18BF603FDCD646.description: Identify the various roles of leaders within organizations and give examples of positive leadership skills.

F2BA6760E7B44285847A35C2340AF28F.description: Implement leadership skills to accomplish team goals and objectives.

009D13BCCF9D42C4959472DAD38B9A33.description: Students will apply leadership skills in real-world, family, community and business and industry applications.

C1F7F050F6D04EF79190B7BFF5447B79.description: Discuss the impact of communication and information technology.

83F78B1D0F9E497D974100AD89197BA7.description: Describe the nature of problems and how they can have multiple elements.

C7665932C63945C4A446987911303DCC.description: Select and use communication and information technology to help solve problems and provide opportunities.

08FFD1D1316B4E70BDBEBF7A13AA8F17.description: Discuss how technology can serve as a positive and negative distraction.

26BC2079584A437292AA2B02ADDEF211.description: Explore and use data management tools.

AB0E40862B114D3FAE8BFC6B15ECE1A9.description: Adopt new technological tools to increase personal and organizational productivity.

91BA6E3401E0430598977CEE0CC8D4DE.description: Students will use available information and communication technology to improve productivity, solve problems and create opportunities.

D25BDFE6AD7F481E881EC2D959ED8FA0.description: Identify common principles of graphic design and advertising.

151B89402610470195C44A7BC3F42FFB.description: Prepare media products in order to communicate a specific message.

BCDABA9EB41F4EB8AFA60F409B069AAA.description: Discuss how individual and group biases can affect how information is received.

FA7F7F96924C488D8311A0BB6D191ACB.description: Discuss how individual and group biases can affect how information is portrayed.

E4D00B4503C04A1888ED4AA2CC5215DE.description: Analyze media messages to determine biases and objectivity.

EAE5FAE12AE14D23A901F89C8AB6EF6F.description: Students will apply information literacy skills to access and evaluate media to design and produce media products.

75AEE29C217246928BBF3EE70FDAE4E2.description: Collect and review data and information from multiple sources.

0273B6B9270C4966B88AA2DC3346A7B8.description: Identify different ways to communicate data and information.

16B4A2F8597D478F97A51AE16601F769.description: Apply data and information to communicate ideas and create new opportunities.

9B5771C228FA4E4D9E5E92932EFF8BB6.description: Explain the concepts of relevance and reliability as they relate to data and information.

4B3668CEF2F7410D80F97C69C06E2321.description: Select relevant information necessary for making decisions and solving problems.

8B2A6E9C1F0743CE8A873C72B23C39C0.description: Describe the concepts of relevance, validity and timeliness as they relate to data and information.

C7CCA3B47A254FAEBE94C3BE5E91F4DA.description: Discuss various electronic and non-electronic sources of data and information.

6AF8C8BBB2B646B7AC3BA6566DB82AD1.description: Describe the concepts of raw data and information.

793DBA09479C40A79F8E63662B9B7F67.description: Determine the relevance, validity and timeliness of data and information.

C5EC44561FBE4898B718415408985D4C.description: Discuss how individual and group biases can affect how information is portrayed.

328A2CFFAB264DBC99E690DC214357AF.description: Give examples of various sources of data and information.

681D210F50684259806A8B43A6038E8D.description: Choose appropriate sources of data and information for a given purpose.

40ABB3AD4E83478A9D4932CC3B0B8830.description: Students will access, interpret and evaluate information from a variety of sources in order to inform and support premises, arguments, decisions, ideas and initiatives.

917D3D528CCD445FA6FD56988B74DF54.description: Identify how groups comprised of individuals from diverse backgrounds may approach situations differently than those of similar backgrounds.

7DA09A425BFE4F2B8EC931A918917D45.description: Identify benefits of working with someone with a diverse background or set of experiences.

E4B5F6C226C749389CC47E3CC4905F2A.description: List differences between self and others on a team.

BDED836EF8714C218DF127AE9BC66D77.description: Develop innovative solutions and initiatives as part of a diverse team.

087C646C384A463A93146F2D159BD503.description: List ways in which people are different from one another.

B071A2A9B90C40ECB9AD7BA6400D7D6D.description: Work effectively with diverse individuals in a variety of settings and contexts.

4395512ADDCF428AA4BBA4BAB2D4AEEC.description: Students will assess the benefits and challenges of working in diverse settings and on diverse teams.

706C056FE255477ABC38EB892E92B709.description: Describe how diverse groups of people can work together.

EF7DEA883DBD407BBAE862CC2213676E.description: Identify ways in which diversity has led to innovation and opportunity.

755407C638364D2AAB90E3D16060F1D0.description: Explain how diverse groups of people can work together to overcome local, national, regional and global crises.

9A16E0B59B9941D4AC5FFFADC44E6FB8.description: Summarize challenges and crises taking place in various parts of the world.

2F0FD6DBEB614DBEA948EC6F04E81ACA.description: Discuss how personal differences can contribute to conflict between individuals.

D9AD9CC567B94CB98AA975B1D4467407.description: Summarize events taking place in various parts of the world.

F2C710AB055F4015B176BD3AE90780D1.description: Explain how events in one part of the world affect nations, communities and individuals in other parts of the world.

AFFCD2D0472B4C28BDAE8871F6BF400D.description: Identify historical examples of large ethnic groups emigrating to a new country or community.

1D027DDDD4CB426C951F3A1DB0686753.description: List ways in which communities are different from one another.

465B27E6C8954419A3B44DAA6FEF21FE.description: List ways in which people are different from one another.

D8F8433A28E24919AC956AFBB3FAFBB6.description: Evaluate the effects of diversity encountered through interactions with people in or from other parts of the community, state, nation and world.

EC6F9F4233A74D06B25A5D0EE5D75F6A.description: Students will propose solutions and initiatives related to global issues.

0EF2E52131514DBC8929B805EB5AA720.description: Explain the origin of rules and laws to promote health and safety in school and work.

6C5E8BC6681A4307986DDCC28A30B0C4.description: Identify different types of jobs and how safety and health systems operate.

C420DC8F0AF34E4DB2E9B69AA30EA177.description: Identify health and safety considerations in the classroom along with individual responsibility for maintaining conditions.

EF21D12651084675B096BB7DD919A1B0.description: Implement personal and jobsite safety rules and regulations to maintain and improve safe and healthful working conditions and environments.

AB4D55CE48E3442AA1ABB1999A9C8FD2.description: Identify short-term and long-term solutions to a problem.

6609ECDC1E3244F0BB5A97AD6129F1AB.description: Identify local or regional social, economic and ecological issues.

0A598EFC30F34627A646B7B10D28C708.description: Identify examples of how personal actions can influence social, economic and ecological systems.

01815679B8604913BC2E2593E51936F8.description: Develop solutions to social, economic and ecological problems without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their needs.

27E942D1321446C182AC109DE33DD2D7.description: Identify questions that require skilled investigation to solve current social, economic and ecological problems.

235FCBA5739F43D08898D584F5623E93.description: Engage in a decision-making process that includes selecting and using data, suggesting possible alternatives, predicting consequences and defending the decision.

A988EA810249495F99370AECB9F2B8AB.description: Engage in systems thinking and inquiry processes that identify problems while analyzing the impacts of decisions made now and in the future.

58CFE1BFF92C4207A6F2693AA450F6A5.description: Identify and give examples of short-term and long-term solutions to a problem.

CDB7CC9AB85F49D7A33F3D10DAD7DB02.description: Describe how personal choices impact natural and human-built systems.

F530590A3244452F88D4AD9A357A4FE6.description: Describe how social, ecological and economic systems have benefits and consequences.

96143C5685E64DE188E2C1618E3E19F6.description: Recognize and describe various types of natural and human-built systems.

37DAA7EACFF848C8A02D379A0BF25F28.description: Assess the interdependency among natural and human-built systems, including social, ecological and economic health.

C0405FAE0A96416185A53AC5548E973B.description: Students will identify the importance and interrelationships of health, safety and environmental systems and evaluate the impacts of these systems on organizational performance for continuous improvement.

F41880C4ADA443ADB619CF57649410A7.description: Define what it means to be respectful and non-judgmental.

99060F47C32A45CDA1D75C0EEAE78E2B.description: Recognize the appro­priate behavior and communication skills necessary in adult interactions.

7CAAE785487E43DEBA8E62B89BBD1F83.description: Identify and exhibit traits for retaining employment.

BBB64433F21348FE870A1F628A0FCB87.description: Identify the qualities employers may seek in a candidate.

70799490B65241AC90AE1A61E69B4030.description: Demonstrate skills related to seeking and applying for employment to find and obtain a desired job.

51D2C04BB64E4FDFB8F0292FCEFDF6C5.description: Describe positive work-qualities typically desired in each of the career cluster's pathways.

50665CF5F0EA47E2B5A18760408DF451.description: Identify behaviors that demonstrate self-discipline, self-worth, positive attitude and integrity.

02E1CFCECE1340A88310AAE448BA1FEB.description: Identify and demonstrate positive work behaviors and personal qualities needed to be employable.

B30BC8F7B95A4082B48B4FFE3D868211.description: Students will identify and apply employability skills.

31FD616E2E44450E979A6ABF1A457901.description: Demonstrate the ability to seek assistance (e.g., with problems at school or work) from appropriate resources, including other people.

C2B3452646AA44729A9A7952E291035B.description: Explain how good nutrition, adequate rest and physical activity affect energy levels and productivity in school and at work.

B62F68DAD0F64280AD33B4448D3A8111.description: Employ career management strategies to achieve future career success and satisfaction.

4A1A14D846734BC1BE49BD6B05955CCA.description: Describe why people work and how aspects of the work environment affect lifestyle.

9BBAD89A14344A6BA2BDC2D8F0C790C4.description: Examine and evaluate opportunities that could enhance life and career plans and articulate plan to guide decisions and actions.

B603530C2DFB4EEF8B280062F7418D09.description: Identify career opportunities of interest; match personal interests and aptitudes.

D8EF9EC8E05C4F9BB2A59CB188766769.description: Give examples of positive personal characteristics (e.g., honesty, dependability, responsibility, integrity and loyalty).

85B414387EF749A1B789531F5A0A8488.description: Discuss and explain behaviors and decisions that reflect interests, likes and dislikes.

EDB9CF942B9A4DBFB0DEDDC0A02B0018.description: Locate, evaluate and interpret career information.

AA35096F51AC4C0198D32037086DAAAB.description: Investigate the world of work in order to gain knowledge of self in order to make informed career decisions.

908A32913BAD4D0FACD66424423E883F.description: Students will create and manage a flexible and responsive individualized learning plan to meet their career goals.

940C3C3DA1164467A5D39E205859AC46.description: Explore local and regional labor market and job growth information.

E44962118E0744DCA5D55DC611E2655B.description: Set realistic expectations for work and achievement.

1FAE05F0E9F24D9DBC71DEB3EA623DC6.description: Assess attitudes and skills that contribute to successful learning in school and across the life span.

05FCA2B7515B47E79F328E4732B1122D.description: Students will identify the connection between educational achievement and work opportunities in order to reach personal and career goals.

06CCB28A2992462BB0281A9093B49E93.description: Demonstrate when, where and how to seek help with solving problems and making decisions.

3B51ADA5E0E9465096D0841D3A9D81FB.description: Define what a decision is and how decisions can be made.

CF1A5FE5AB504B8F9AE583DB5FD58A55.description: Apply a range of relevant decision-making strategies.

EFC4DF9F4C544A1F8AF920C4233AE285.description: Describe what it means to show respect and appreciation for individual and cultural differences.

FAA1FA1B7352450E9EB6E3CE59D2A62A.description: Recognize personal boundaries, rights and privacy needs.

8F86C1B1B7704A4184D9B6EEA51D4F83.description: Identify when it is appropriate to listen and when it is appropriate to speak.

773B2A86C1F7430F859E01E3740BDDC9.description: Interact effectively with others in similar and diverse teams.

97E5BC1248B6471095B43EC1766761AA.description: Define a goal and describe why it is important to have goals.

7AE265B70F0045AD9ED4A6CEFAA95C0F.description: Recognize conse­quences of decisions and choices.

97B795192D184B96A9374C39AFDCFAD1.description: Demonstrate effective decision-making, problem solving and goal setting.

230D1B608E7C43DAB733F4E236345BDB.description: Identify individual likes and dislikes related to utilizing skills and abilities.

9CBA26CCDC514CE5AD33839024D89B62.description: Identify person strengths, aptitudes and passions.

8FA3EC58777145A09B90A230B28B9AA5.description: Students will consider, analyze and apply an awareness of self, identity and culture to identify skills and talents.

78D09BB43A684703AF8CD2A923B41421.description: Explain ways in which an act might be considered ethical or unethical.

13E4AD4A2E3240238BC8115F93668513.description: Describe ways of resolving conflicts within a team or group.

17F4AB9C097F46C9B7FBA1A619C7499E.description: Compare and contrast ways of resolving conflicts with another person.

C8C010B04CCA406F9FD28A1BDF888F31.description: Use interpersonal skills to resolve conflicts with others in an ethical manner.

9969C4DB7FFE44A4BE758CED514C66A4.description: Compare the impact of face-to-face discussion with the use of technology for communication.

1A83CE0CBC314D0EB6BFAB445741ED9A.description: Complete an assignment as part of a group.

B2AFD9920DF5413EB607773BBD065855.description: Describe various ways of generating ideas in a group setting.

469AA58B8C254073936760F0C746D3C0.description: Describe various ways people communicate with each other without using words.

443EF78E905E45D6BABC80D42D45BC83.description: Identify a person's emotions based on expressions and body language.

DEACFBABCD6C4B60B7B6B8789094EB15.description: Discuss a shared experience with others.

A7762E927A0A499D9A6021CB77468614.description: Communicate thoughts and feelings with others using verbal and non-verbal language.

FBE22DB08B324C3B91E67926BCA08EC7.description: Students will communicate and collaborate with others to accomplish tasks and develop solutions to problems and opportunities.

BF1D18D2577949EAB81E7BE3AC4A269E.description: Describe how knowledge learned in one class can be used in other classes and situations.

D63DF1CA5B4C4A928215358AC2DA5FF5.description: Describe how past experience relates to new situations.

3C6A02E78CF84D89B3EEBE6D79D19CD9.description: Develop and implement a resolution for a new situation using personal knowledge and experience.

39FDC060E8284BA1B59957C5527B0A8B.description: Describe the concept of systems thinking.

CD004EE2B143496999408777256C463C.description: Explain the negative aspects of making decisions without adequate information and/or thought.

8205C177752F4EDA8CC200E8E22EB1DE.description: Explain problems, decisions and opportunities faced by individuals and communities.

D87A73417A1A478AA2E5145816756A51.description: Develop effective resolutions for a given problem, decision or opportunity using available information.

570069E8B9F349308CF439A4866D4BDB.description: Students will formulate and defend judgments and decisions by employing critical thinking skills.

C8BD84F528C74DF08C2BD47774DCA142.description: Explain the value of multiple perspectives in solving problems and recognizing opportunities.

67F8FE290B254A2BB6DF6489E3577D75.description: Participate with a group to develop new ideas.

DA14CD2838EA4237AC1A2AC18060ED65.description: Recognize that an individual's background and experiences influence their perspective of problems and solutions.

DACED4C39FF14A0C8179B5C6200DAD99.description: Work creatively with others to develop solutions, products and services.

0657AA0F378545EDA9AC3AB08F3A8528.description: Explain how a solution to one problem may or may not work for a related problem or situation.

E5BC0F34D45E4A31AB9127CA94C53009.description: Explain how human needs and desires drive innovation.

07838AC7FC92427B93CEC444A249A6A3.description: Recognize that there can be multiple ways to solve a problem.

43B7EADAD08F4D2691985BFF243BEF68.description: Develop original solutions, products and services to meet a given need.

2EE85BA5B7E1474B9D072A94F871F479.description: Students will think and work creatively to develop innovative solutions to problems and opportunities.
